author: aticomismana
title: cardway.finance - A payment gateway
description: For merchants from developing countries it is not practical to accept ADA as a means of payment. Therefore, restricting mass adoption.

f6_assessments.q0: I think this idea is cool, but it's not essential. Taking payment in ADA and having it automatically converted to local currency would be very practical for local Latin American sellers. On the other hand, I see some issues here: starting with the fact that converting ADA into other currencies is not something that involves a lot of "time and money" to be done, as the author of the proposal says. I do this quickly through Yoroi wallet and Binance brokerage, the total process between sending my ADA to Binance from brokerage to my bank costs me around 2 units of my local currency. And it doesn't take more than 20 minutes to do it. Therefore, I believe that the core of this proposal is not as fundamental as the author claims. We also have the fact that it is sometimes more advantageous to expect the ADA to be valued to convert than to convert at the exact moment we receive the cryptocurrency. I'm not saying wait months as this is not feasible for traders. But in a matter of a week, the currency could appreciate a lot. And I believe that those who choose to work with the ADA are aware of their voters and seek to make the best possible use of it. The author gives us very good explanations about his dApp, so that we can understand well how his activities would work in practice. I recognize that it would be a project that could greatly benefit the Cardano ecosystem, but due to its high price of 156k in financing and the possibility of doing the same things without creating a specific dApp, in addition to the factors I have reviewed above, I believe that the same money could be used on different projects with more valid ideas.
f6_assessments.q1: The script is divided into phases, each phase being very well explained through subtopics. In relation to this part of the proposal, I believe the author provides us with a very good amount of detail, so that we can have a very solid view of the process, that is, what would need to be done in parts to carry out the project. About the team, the author informs us which professionals would be needed, but from what I understand, he has not yet defined who the other team members would be. There are no details about anyone other than the author. This is complicated, because there is no way to build trust in people you don't know. It would be important for the author to define a team, or at least 80% of it, and properly present each member: names, roles, previous work, etc. In this way, confidence in your ability to successfully execute the project would be conveyed. And about financing, the author explains to us based on topics how the money would be used. However, I believe we would need more detail here. For example $6400 for 6 months of app server. Why does it cost so much? What would the server be? More than 28k for the project manager/development leader: why is this role so expensive, what would this person do in practice, what would their day-to-day work be like?
f6_assessments.q2: The author sets metrics to be achieved 6 months after launch. In this way, we would have something to monitor as the semester progresses: were the promised results really achieved? However, as this is an expensive and complex project, I would have liked monthly goals to be followed. In this way, we could carry out closer monitoring and at shorter intervals, increasing the quality level of this auditability. We can also follow the process through the information provided in the script. I think the author himself could be in charge of gathering this data located in the metrics and presenting it to the community (as I said, monthly would be better). Also, two or three professionals could be chosen to monitor the process, people from the Cardano ecosystem who have a sufficient technical base to understand the functioning of the technologies developed here. Therefore, I believe that yes, the author provides us with auditable information, it is enough that they were more in-depth and that the community kept in constant contact with him/her team, in order to periodically monitor the progress of things.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses a clear problem and is in line with the needs of the challenge, as the solution would have a positive impact both at the local level, in the market place for developing countries, but would also allow many people to use ADA as a means of payment, allowing an impact on the whole ecosystem. This project, with the training of a team for its implementation, would also allow the integration of new people into the community. This coordinates with the objectives described in the metrics. However, the reflection of this project in terms of its impact on the Catalyst ecosystem is missing, and some explanations would have helped to certify the participant's awareness of this process. Furthermore, the paragraph stating a plan for a long-term vision and the project itself suggests that it would have the potential to address future challenges, which is also a good point.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is difficult to identify which members of the project team are already present and which members will need to be found to form the team needed to implement the project. It would have been preferable to provide more information and links to the people behind the project, which would have been an additional confidence building factor. Also information about how the participant plan to find additional people for the team. 
Especially since, unless I'm mistaken, the budget requested represents about 30% of the total budget of the challenge, which is well detailed in technical terms and details of the procedure, but really lacks information. Because even if an idea is well elaborated, it seems difficult to attest the success of a project without having confidence in the team that will carry it out. In the same way that the risks are mentioned, but the precision of the team's solutions to deal with them are not mentioned.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is clear and the solution provided is quite transparent, in terms of the budget, the technical process and its development over time, the KPIs seem coherent and quantitative. Although it is stated in phase 3 that there will be documentation and reports, it would have been important to provide more informations on how the project plans to communicate with the community on its progress. There are no links, or a given site, that would allow for feedback or follow-up, exept that :"All material produced (documentation and source codes from GitHub) is open source under the Creative Commons "BY" license", which is a good point. But by developing more its auditability for the community, this project could become more integrated into the community and find partners or mentors to support and provide additional elements to prove its potential of success.

If this project is success, it can impact not only Latin America but also all other parts of the world because currently many place don't have this type of app to actually use crypto currency in daily transaction.
f6_assessments.q1: The solution, though, seems still quite complicated since it needs the p2p trader, the merchants have to confirm within the time or time limit is reached, and if it's not, there will have process veryfing to decide whether or not to release the tokens. It seems complicated and I afraid that local merchants might not adopt this method because they used to the simple traditional transaction. f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes roadmap to track the progress of the project and the KPIs which is very transparent and useful to measure the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned above, the proposers took to a great level of engagement, and action, on the feedback given this far. As with the budget, there is also a well thought out set of roadmap and KPIs/metrics that make sense. The number one metric I was hoping to see added was merchants and users using the platform. f6_assessments.q0: The problem regarding merchants in developing countries not being able to accept ADA payment when needed is stated quite clearly. The solution given is among the lines of this problem given that with already existent decentralized exchanges, that work with stablecoins, like COTI, the code is not open-source for commercial reasons probably. Also other applications like Adapay do not allow conversion to stablecoins or fiat currency, a feature that cardway finance has. For those reasons, i think that this idea would have great impact to the Cardano ecosystem and will add great value to it, giving the chance of mass adoption.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has experience on developing applications and also has experience with various languages, including smart contract languages. However, the proposer does not give any links to verify that or a github account. What could be confusing for a voter, is the fact that there is one team member at this time and all other team members are to be hired. The proposer gives a 2 month time for the team to be built and the prototype to be implemented, which is marginally feasible. Maybe consider extending the project horizon. The budget, however, is outlined clearly and seems to be reasonable to achieve the goals set. The timetable is stated clearly, the only thing to be added would be the public launch. The defined success targets in terms of users sound a bit ambitious. I really hope this can be achieved but I believe this will require great effort and promotion.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal defines a clear timeline/roadmap for the project. There are 3 incremental phases with separate milestones which makes the project more auditable. The prototype, documentation and all source code will be continuously available on GitHub as open source software under Creative Commons "BY" license. There will also be a public testnet. Finally, the proposer defines success metrics and gives specific target number, which is really good.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is to find the practical means of accepting ADA payment. I am not sure the inclusion of fiat currency and stablecoin in the solution can effectively provide the solution.
f6_assessments.q1: A number of members are still to be hired. I believe these vacancies are essential to get the proposal implemented on time (deadline 6 months). I therefore cannot be sure for the successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Given the field testings being planned after completion of the App, I would think there is some measure at the end of a period shorter than 6 months after launch proposed, so as to discover early the practical problems that may hamper the success of the proposal.

solution: Development of a dApp for merchants to receive payment in ADA, allowing automatic conversion to stablecoin or fiat currency.
experience: Developer for over 10 years, with experience C++, Java, C#, Python and Javascript. Stakepool Operator since Shelley Testnet, Plutus Pioneer.
